subject: Re: [junit] Doing something once per test case

messageBody:
Mike Lin wrote:
>
> Hi, I'm fairly new to junit, but hopefully this is reasonable.
>
> I'm testing a class that send out packets, so in my testcase I start a
> thread that listens on a port and then tell the class under test to
> send the packets to that port at localhost. The test thread then waits
> for the receiving thread to notify it when the packets are received.
> The test thread then gets the packets from the receiving thread.
>
> So I want to only start the receiving thread once per testcase and not
> once per test. Otherwise I have multiple receiving threads trying to
> bind to the same socket. I also have difficulty stopping the receiving
> thread in tearDown because it is i/o blocked and even if I interrupt
> it, it does not terminate before the next test starts.

junit.extensions.TestSetup is what you want. This will run your setup
and tear down only one for the entire test suite. The JUnit FAQ will
show you how to use it.
